#: Fields with this name are used for comments and as a documentation, they are not parsed by the prompt builder.
It's not recommended to copy this file directly. Copy default.json instead and use this file for reference only.
Name: Sample
Description: A sample prompt profile. Not likely to work well but implements all the features of the prompt builder and has comments. Good for a reference when making your own prompt profiles.
style_prompt: full body portrait, d780 80mm lens, photorealistic, black background

#: Add prompts depending on current happiness value of a person.

expression_prompt.#: Simple format. Adds a positive prompt if happiness is above 160.
Complex format. Adds both positive and negative prompts.

walking_away.#: Determines if feet-relevant (shoes, socks etc.) prompts should be added to the final prompt when in this position.
Determines if leg-relevant (thighhighs etc.) prompts should be added to the final prompt when in this position.

Determines if breasts-relevant (breast size etc.) prompts should be added to the final prompt when in this position.
If prompt builder finds the exact same prompt part in both negative in positive prompts, it will remove that part from the positive prompt.
Use this when you want to override a person's expression in the current position.

#: Add prompt modifications for skin color prompts. Typical skin prompts looks like "{color}" skin.

skin_prompt.#: Prompt builder generates a default prompt based on a current person, e.g. "white skin".
Then it takes the variable part of a prompt (in this example it's "white") and looks
for a full match in the relevant substitution dictionary (see below).
1. If match is found, prompt builder will substitute the variable part with the "pos" value of the substitution object.
2. If no match is found the default prompt will be added as is.
3. If matched value has an empty string as "pos" value, no positive prompt will be added.

substitutions.#: Complex substitution. Overrides positive part of a prompts and adds a negative prompt.
Full substitution. Instead of replacing only the variable part of a prompt, override it with the provided value.

#: Add prompt modifications for outfits/body part prompts. Typical clothing prompt looks like "{color} {name}".

outfit_prompt.#: Custom color map that will be used to determine color's name in the generated prompt.
Uses simple RGB distance to determine "closest color". May lead to unexpected results, such as purple-ish dress resolving to grey color in prompt.
This dictionary is used only for substituting a piece of clothing's name. Colors should be resolved using color dict above.

substitutions.#: Names are the same is in the game's wardrobe, but lowercase.

daisy dukes.#: If false, do not prepend clothing's color to the generated prompt.

#: Add prompt modifications for hair color/style prompts. Typical hair prompt looks like "{color} {style}".

details_prompt.#: This substitution dict is used for both color and style.

negative_prompt: 2girls, greyscale, monochrome, cg, render, unreal engine, low quality, watermark
